verses.text_plain: And David spake unto the Lord the words of this song in the day that the Lord had delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul:
verses.verse_html: 1And David spake unto the Lord the words of this song in the day that the Lord had delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul:

verses.text_plain: And he said, The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;
verses.verse_html: 2And he said, The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;

verses.text_plain: The God of my rock; in him will I trust: he is my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge, my saviour; thou savest me from violence.
verses.verse_html: 3The God of my rock; in him will I trust: he is my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge, my saviour; thou savest me from violence.

verses.text_plain: I will call on the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
verses.verse_html: 4I will call on the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.

verses.text_plain: When the waves of death compassed me, the floods of ungodly men made me afraid;
verses.verse_html:
5When the waves of death compassed me, the floods of ungodly men made me afraid; ▼
▼ waves: or, pangs
 , ▼
▼ ungodly…: Heb. Belial

footnotes.body_html: ▼ waves: or, pangs
▼ ungodly…: Heb. Belial

verses.text_plain: The sorrows of hell compassed me about; the snares of death prevented me;
verses.verse_html:
6The sorrows of hell compassed me about; the snares of death prevented me; ▼
▼ sorrows: or, cords

footnotes.body_html: ▼ sorrows: or, cords

verses.text_plain: In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God: and he did hear my voice out of his temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.
verses.verse_html: 7In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God: and he did hear my voice out of his temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.

verses.text_plain: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations of heaven moved and shook, because he was wroth.
verses.verse_html: 8Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations of heaven moved and shook, because he was wroth.

verses.text_plain: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
verses.verse_html:
9There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it. ▼
▼ out of his nostrils: Heb. by, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ out of his nostrils: Heb. by, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ out of his nostrils: Heb. by, etc

verses.text_plain: He bowed the heavens also, and came down; and darkness was under his feet.
verses.verse_html: 10He bowed the heavens also, and came down; and darkness was under his feet.

verses.text_plain: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: and he was seen upon the wings of the wind.
verses.verse_html: 11And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: and he was seen upon the wings of the wind.

verses.text_plain: And he made darkness pavilions round about him, dark waters, and thick clouds of the skies.
verses.verse_html:
12And he made darkness pavilions round about him, dark waters, and thick clouds of the skies. ▼
▼ dark…: Heb. binding of waters

footnotes.body_html: ▼ dark…: Heb. binding of waters

verses.text_plain: Through the brightness before him were coals of fire kindled.
verses.verse_html: 13Through the brightness before him were coals of fire kindled.

verses.text_plain: The Lord thundered from heaven, and the most High uttered his voice.
verses.verse_html: 14The Lord thundered from heaven, and the most High uttered his voice.

verses.text_plain: And he sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and discomfited them.
verses.verse_html: 15And he sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and discomfited them.

verses.text_plain: And the channels of the sea appeared, the foundations of the world were discovered, at the rebuking of the Lord, at the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
verses.verse_html: 16And the channels of the sea appeared, the foundations of the world were discovered, at the rebuking of the Lord, at the blast of the breath of his nostrils.

verses.text_plain: He sent from above, he took me; he drew me out of many waters;
verses.verse_html:
17He sent from above, he took me; he drew me out of many waters; ▼
▼ many: or, great

footnotes.body_html: ▼ many: or, great

verses.text_plain: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.
verses.verse_html: 18He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.

tokens.text: me: for they were too strong

verses.text_plain: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the Lord was my stay.
verses.verse_html: 19They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the Lord was my stay.

verses.text_plain: He brought me forth also into a large place: he delivered me, because he delighted in me.
verses.verse_html: 20He brought me forth also into a large place: he delivered me, because he delighted in me.

verses.text_plain: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness: according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
verses.verse_html: 21The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness: according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.

verses.text_plain: For I have kept the ways of the Lord, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
verses.verse_html: 22For I have kept the ways of the Lord, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

verses.text_plain: For all his judgments were before me: and as for his statutes, I did not depart from them.
verses.verse_html: 23For all his judgments were before me: and as for his statutes, I did not depart from them.

verses.text_plain: I was also upright before him, and have kept myself from mine iniquity.
verses.verse_html:
24I was also upright before him, and have kept myself from mine iniquity. ▼
▼ before: Heb. to

footnotes.body_html: ▼ before: Heb. to

verses.text_plain: Therefore the Lord hath recompensed me according to my righteousness; according to my cleanness in his eye sight.
verses.verse_html:
25Therefore the Lord hath recompensed me according to my righteousness; according to my cleanness in his eye sight. ▼
▼ in…: Heb. before his eyes

footnotes.body_html: ▼ in…: Heb. before his eyes

verses.text_plain: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful, and with the upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright.
verses.verse_html: 26With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful, and with the upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright.

verses.text_plain: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself unsavoury.
verses.verse_html:
27With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself unsavoury. ▼
▼ shew thyself unsavoury: or, wrestle

footnotes.body_html: ▼ shew thyself unsavoury: or, wrestle

verses.text_plain: And the afflicted people thou wilt save: but thine eyes are upon the haughty, that thou mayest bring them down.
verses.verse_html: 28And the afflicted people thou wilt save: but thine eyes are upon the haughty, that thou mayest bring them down.

verses.text_plain: For thou art my lamp, O Lord: and the Lord will lighten my darkness.
verses.verse_html:
29For thou art my lamp, O Lord: and the Lord will lighten my darkness. ▼
▼ lamp: or, candle

footnotes.body_html: ▼ lamp: or, candle

verses.text_plain: For by thee I have run through a troop: by my God have I leaped over a wall.
verses.verse_html:
30For by thee I have run through a troop: by my God have I leaped over a wall. ▼
▼ run: or, broken

tokens.text: For by thee I have run

footnotes.body_html: ▼ run: or, broken

verses.text_plain: As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.
verses.verse_html:
31As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him. ▼
▼ tried: or, refined

footnotes.body_html: ▼ tried: or, refined

verses.text_plain: For who is God, save the Lord? and who is a rock, save our God?
verses.verse_html: 32For who is God, save the Lord? and who is a rock, save our God?

verses.text_plain: God is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect.
verses.verse_html:
33God is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect. ▼
▼ maketh: Heb. riddeth, or, looseth

footnotes.body_html: ▼ maketh: Heb. riddeth, or, looseth

verses.text_plain: He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet: and setteth me upon my high places.
verses.verse_html:
34He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet: and setteth me upon my high places. ▼
▼ maketh: Heb. equalleth

footnotes.body_html: ▼ maketh: Heb. equalleth

verses.text_plain: He teacheth my hands to war; so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.
verses.verse_html:
35He teacheth my hands to war; so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms. ▼
▼ to war: Heb. for the war

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to war: Heb. for the war
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to war: Heb. for the war

verses.text_plain: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy gentleness hath made me great.
verses.verse_html:
36Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy gentleness hath made me great. ▼
▼ made…: Heb. multiplied me

footnotes.body_html: ▼ made…: Heb. multiplied me

verses.text_plain: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; so that my feet did not slip.
verses.verse_html:
37Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; so that my feet did not slip. ▼
▼ feet: Heb. ankles

tokens.text: under me; so that my feet

footnotes.body_html: ▼ feet: Heb. ankles

verses.text_plain: I have pursued mine enemies, and destroyed them; and turned not again until I had consumed them.
verses.verse_html: 38I have pursued mine enemies, and destroyed them; and turned not again until I had consumed them.

verses.text_plain: And I have consumed them, and wounded them, that they could not arise: yea, they are fallen under my feet.
verses.verse_html: 39And I have consumed them, and wounded them, that they could not arise: yea, they are fallen under my feet.

tokens.text: them, that they could not arise

verses.text_plain: For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose up against me hast thou subdued under me.
verses.verse_html:
40For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose up against me hast thou subdued under me. ▼
▼ subdued: Heb. caused to bow

footnotes.body_html: ▼ subdued: Heb. caused to bow

verses.text_plain: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.
verses.verse_html: 41Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.

verses.text_plain: They looked, but there was none to save; even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.
verses.verse_html: 42They looked, but there was none to save; even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.

verses.text_plain: Then did I beat them as small as the dust of the earth, I did stamp them as the mire of the street, and did spread them abroad.
verses.verse_html: 43Then did I beat them as small as the dust of the earth, I did stamp them as the mire of the street, and did spread them abroad.

tokens.text: them as small as the dust

verses.text_plain: Thou also hast delivered me from the strivings of my people, thou hast kept me to be head of the heathen: a people which I knew not shall serve me.
verses.verse_html: 44Thou also hast delivered me from the strivings of my people, thou hast kept me to be head of the heathen: a people which I knew not shall serve me.

verses.text_plain: Strangers shall submit themselves unto me: as soon as they hear, they shall be obedient unto me.
verses.verse_html:
45Strangers shall submit themselves unto me: as soon as they hear, they shall be obedient unto me. ▼
▼ Strangers: Heb. Sons of the stranger
 , ▼
▼ submit…: or, yield feigned obedience: Heb. lie

tokens.text: themselves unto me: as soon as they hear

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Strangers: Heb. Sons of the stranger
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Strangers: Heb. Sons of the stranger

footnotes.body_text: ▼ submit…: or, yield feigned obedience: Heb. lie
footnotes.body_html: ▼ submit…: or, yield feigned obedience: Heb. lie

verses.text_plain: Strangers shall fade away, and they shall be afraid out of their close places.
verses.verse_html: 46Strangers shall fade away, and they shall be afraid out of their close places.

verses.text_plain: The Lord liveth; and blessed be my rock; and exalted be the God of the rock of my salvation.
verses.verse_html: 47The Lord liveth; and blessed be my rock; and exalted be the God of the rock of my salvation.

verses.text_plain: It is God that avengeth me, and that bringeth down the people under me,
verses.verse_html:
48It is God that avengeth me, and that bringeth down the people under me, ▼
▼ avengeth: Heb. giveth avengement for

footnotes.body_html: ▼ avengeth: Heb. giveth avengement for

verses.text_plain: And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.
verses.verse_html: 49And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

tokens.text: thou also hast lifted me up on high

verses.text_plain: Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name.
verses.verse_html: 50Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name.

verses.text_plain: He is the tower of salvation for his king: and sheweth mercy to his anointed, unto David, and to his seed for evermore.
verses.verse_html: 51He is the tower of salvation for his king: and sheweth mercy to his anointed, unto David, and to his seed for evermore.
